alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 6:02PM CDT until July 11 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Clara, Woodwards, West King, Boice, Whistler, Hiwannee, Winchester, Denham, Chicora, Strengthford, Eucutta, Gretna and Belmont.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
